112: Complete [Name:QuestTitle ] with [Digit:2digits Idx="1" ] or more sync pairs that share each of the following themes and with [Digit:2digits Idx="2" ] or fewer sync pairs falling to 0 HP:
113:
What riddle did Wallace present you
with before the tea party?
114:
What riddle did Nessa present you
with before the tea party?
115:
What riddle did Darach present you
with before the tea party?
116:
What riddle did Piers present you
with before the tea party?
117:
I’d love to see a whole pile of
sparkly, blue crystals...
118:
Mingling with other Trainers is key to
expanding your social circle.
When’s the last time you struck up
a conversation?
119:
I wanna meet a guy with rock-solid
willpower! And he better have a
rock-solid Pokémon, too!
Bring someone like that to a Riddle
Mission Battle!
120:
I’d love to have a nice chat with a
fellow nature lover.
Could you bring someone like that to
a Riddle Mission Battle?
121:
Hey! Find me three sync pairs that are
good at disrupting opponents, and
bring them to a Riddle Mission Battle!
122:
Show me you can battle with people
all over the world!
123:
Communicating with your teammates
can sometimes be the difference
between a win and a loss! How do
you relay info to your team?
124:
If you don’t handle certain moves with
care, you might just get zapped!
Show me some moves like that in a
Riddle Mission Battle!
125:
Mommy says I have to be polite and
ladylike, ’specially when we host
fancy dinners at our villa. Can you
find two people who know the right
forks to use and bring them to a
Riddle Mission Battle?
126:
Man, I’ve been feeling totally
exhausted lately... *sigh*
If only someone could lend me a
helping hand... Hey, I know!
Could you bring three sync pairs who
know how to support their teammates
to a Riddle Mission Battle?
127:
Are you a big fan of any sync pairs
in particular? Heh, with so many
excellent Trainers to choose from,
it may be worth reconsidering who
your favorite is...
128:
Tee-hee! I just love milk! I’d drink,
like, five gallons a day if I could! Do
you know any sync pairs that could
help me fulfill my milk obsession?!
If you find one, bring them to a
Riddle Mission Battle, ’kay?
129:
I heard you’re quite light on your feet!
Show me how you dodge attacks.
Any kind of attack will do!
130:
It’s fun saying hi to different folks
around the Pokémon Center! I actually
learned a new greeting the other
day! “Alo...” Hmm... What was it
again? Could you find someone who
can help me remember the rest and
bring them to a Riddle Mission Battle?
131:
This one time, I took down three
Pidgey with one stone. Can you
do that?
132:
What happens if you touch a flame or
spill boiling water on yourself?
Show me you can defeat an opponent
by inflicting a condition like that!
133:
Being able to depend on your friends
is a beautiful thing, but training as an
individual is important, too. Take on a
Riddle Mission Battle yourself to see
how far you’ve come since you began
your adventure!
134:
Show me the power—the glorious
manifestation—of your sync strength
in a Riddle Mission Battle!
135:
Slavir eerht em gnirb!
Your hint is...like Mawile, this riddle
has its back facing you!
136:
Striking at your opponent’s weakness
doesn’t make you a mean person.
It’s battle strategy, pure and simple!
Show me some strategic maneuvers
in a Riddle Mission Battle! Osu!
137:
Use the following move ×[Digit:6digits ]
(counts only if the battle
is completed):
138:
Complete [Name:QuestTitle ]
with [Digit:2digits Idx="1" ] or more sync pairs that share
the following theme in under [Digit:2digits Idx="2" ]:[Digit:2digits Idx="3" ]
139:
Have [Digit:6digits ] [EN:Qty S="interaction" P="interactions" ] in the
Trainer Lodge (counts only if the
[EN:Qty S="interaction is" P="interactions are" ] completed)
140:
Reach friendship level [Digit:7digits Idx="1" ] with
[Digit:3digits ] [EN:Qty S="guest" P="guests" ]
141:
Reach friendship level [Digit:7digits ] with
any guest
142:
Obtain a Level Ball Replica!
Complete missions in “Galar’s
Poké Ball Enthusiast”!
143:
Obtain a Moon Ball Replica!
Search the secret hideout in “Galar’s
Poké Ball Enthusiast”!
144:
Obtain a Fast Ball Replica!
Find 10 Voltorb in “Find the
Ball Pokémon”!
145:
Obtain a Lure Ball Replica!
Find a ball with rare colors
in “Find the Ball Pokémon”!
146:
Obtain a Luxury Ball Replica!
Let’s hatch a bunch of Eggs!
147:
Obtain a Heavy Ball Replica!
Have a look at the item exchange
for “Collecta-ball Poison Gear!”
148:
Obtain a Beast Ball Replica!
I’ll train you up!
151:
Use the following move(s) to complete
[Name:QuestTitle ]:
152:
Obtain a Friend Ball Replica!
Search the secret hideout in “Galar’s
Poké Ball Enthusiast”!
153:
Obtain a Love Ball Replica!
Search the secret hideout in “Galar’s
Poké Ball Enthusiast”!
154:
Would you mind helping me reboot
the city’s power system? It should
work if we use two Electric-type
Pokémon... This isn’t my fault, by
the way.
155:
I like to collect stones, and I’ve found
a rare one I’ve never seen before.

If you find someone who knows
more about stones than I do, can you
bring them to the city?
156:
Do you know this young boy? He
brought me my lost wallet and
left in a flash.

His partner Pokémon had a yellow
beak. Can you bring him to the town
square, so I can thank him?
157:
Hoopa went out to play in the forest
and hasn’t come back. I’m not
particularly worried, but since it’s
already dark, we’re going out to
find Hoopa.

I order sync pairs with Pokémon that
have psychic powers to cooperate
with me!
158:
I’ve heard there’s a Pokémon on
Pasio that was created by
recombining genes of a Mythical
Pokémon. It’s said to be the partner
Pokémon of the leader of
an organization.

If I continue to battle in the arena,
I thought I might be able to see it. I
wonder if that’s true...
159:
How could this happen? Two of the
Pokémon that were supposed to
appear in the show at the square
now can’t come!

Can you search for a Pokémon that
can play the role of a dragon and a
Pokémon that can play the role of a
wild villain?
160:
Quiz time!
Do you know the Coal Pokémon that
spouts smoke from its shell and is a
sync pair with a Gym Leader who has
a fiery passion?

Bring the correct sync pair to
the arena!
161:
I wanna run even faster when I’m
racing around the city square.
Show me how it’s done by using an
X Speed on a Pokémon.
162:
My swim shorts, goggles, and swim
cap got washed away! Can you rally 
three sync pairs that are good
swimmers and help me find my stuff?
163:
It was fun battling on the trolley up
on the mountain! Next time, I wanna
have an interesting battle in
the forest!

I want sync pairs to help me out—
one that can drill through rocks and
another that’s good at
carrying debris!
164:
There’s a kid near the square who
looks sad. I wonder if there’s a sync
pair that can use a certain move to
make them feel more energized?
165:
I saw a tomboyish mermaid riding a
star-like Pokémon in the ocean! If I
wait near the sea, I wonder if I’ll
see her again.
166:
Tonight we’re going into the forest to
unravel the mysteries of the
supernatural.

Hey...you... Bring a friend with you
that’ll be perfect for our outing...
Will you walk the path of darkness
and become a hex maniac with me
and Haunter?
167:
In Alola, there’s an island challenge
where you can take on special trials!

We don’t have those on Pasio, but
the sea reminds me of Alola, and
I’d like to take on a trial there!
168:
I picked a lot of Berries in the forest,
but I’m so full. I want to store the
rest—can you use a Pokémon move
and freeze them for me?
169:
I usually draw in the square, but I’m
stuck in a rut...

I want to learn how others express
themselves artistically, as inspiration.
170:
I was swimming in the sea and came
back to find my towel wet! What to
do... Can you use a Fire-type move
to dry it for me?
171:
My childhood friend went to town to
pick up his brother but hasn’t come
back yet. Can you find him? I think
he’s in a completely different place.

He’s wearing a big cape, so you
might be able to find him if you
look from the sky.
172:
I’ve made some malasadas—Alola’s
local specialty. I want a Trainer from
Alola to try them out and tell me if
they taste authentic.

Can you bring the Trainer to my shop
in the city?
173:
Do you know what a Pokéblock is?
It’s a type of treat that Pokémon love.

I have a kitchen in my shop in the
city. I could lend it to someone who
can teach me how to make
Pokéblocks. Which Trainers would
know how to make them?
174:
Reach Master Rank when the
rankings are finalized in
any High Score Event.
override_detail_5070_1_01:
As a Champion of the Paldea League,
I’d like to go up against a Trainer
from Kanto, where the Pokémon
League HQ is. Although...the fierce
battles in the Galar League are also
exciting! I wanna try both!

(Complete Challenge Nemona: Part 1
with a team including at least one
sync pair each with the Kanto and
Galar themes.)
override_detail_5070_1_02:
There are unique facilities for
Pokémon battling all over the world!
I hear in Unova, you battle on a
running train, and in Kalos, you battle
in restaurants! I bet Trainers who
train in those regions are strong!

(Complete Challenge Nemona: Part 2
with a team including at least one
sync pair each with the Unova and
Kalos themes.)
override_detail_5070_1_03:
Did you know there are places in the
world where only strong Trainers can
go, like the Battle Zone in Sinnoh and
the Battle Tree in Alola? Sync pairs
from regions with places like that
are guaranteed to be strong, right?

(Complete Challenge Nemona: Part 3
with a team including at least one
sync pair each with the Sinnoh and
Alola themes.)
override_detail_5070_1_04:
Would you prefer to train on a
mountain or at the beach? And which
would be a better place to train at if
I’m looking to get stronger—Mt. Silver
in Johto or the wide beaches in
Hoenn? I wanna battle people from
those regions to find out!

(Complete Challenge Nemona: Part 4
with a team including at least one
sync pair each with the Johto and
Hoenn themes.)
override_detail_5070_1_05:
In Paldea, you can’t battle La Primera
without beating the eight Gym
Leaders and the Elite Four. I wonder
how strong other regions’ Gym
Leaders and Elite Four members that
I'll meet on Pasio are!

(Complete Challenge Nemona: Part 5
with a team including at least one
sync pair each with the Gym Leader
and Elite Four themes.)
override_detail_5070_1_06:
I wonder how many people on Pasio
have found the same treasure as
me, a rival.

Also, can I be a little greedy?
I wanna battle other Champions!

(Complete Challenge Nemona: Part 6
with a team including at least one
sync pair each with the Rival and
Champion themes.)
override_detail_5070_1_07:
You remind me of my rival, who I met
in Paldea. They got strong so quickly
after getting their first Pokémon...
What? You know other people like
that?! Tell me who!

(Complete Challenge Nemona: Part 7
with a team including at least one
sync pair with the Main
Character theme.)
175:
Complete any of the following a total
of [Digit:6digits ] [EN:Qty S="time" P="times" ]:
override_detail_5080_1_01:

194:
Reach friendship level [Digit:7digits ] with
the following guest:
override_detail_6040_1_01:
Time to start the Elite Test! Your first
task is to defeat good ol’ Rika. Feel
free to team up with whoever you
want! I’d say I’ll go easy on you,
but...I’d be lying! Think fast!

(Complete Challenge Rika.)
override_detail_6040_1_02:
I don’t do so great against Pokémon
that can float or fly. If I had to battle
a Pokémon like that, it might be
pretty tough...
You catch my drift?

(Complete Challenge Rika with a team
including at least one sync pair with
the Flying theme.)
override_detail_6040_1_03:
I heard sync pairs have this thing
called...roles, I think? Yeah, roles!
Why don’t you try beating me with
a strike sync pair, then?

(Complete Challenge Rika with a team
including at least one strike sync
pair.)
override_detail_6040_1_04:
OK, listen up. In order to get anything
done, you gotta have passion!
Maybe bringing someone with a
really passionate spirit will help you
pass this Elite Test!

(Complete Challenge Rika with a team
including at least one sync pair with
the Passionate Spirit theme.)
override_detail_6040_1_05:
As a member of the Elite Four, I check
in on the Gyms all around Paldea.
Could you team up with other Elite
Four members and Gym Leaders
who’re here on Pasio so I can test
how strong they are?

(Complete Challenge Rika with a team
including at least one sync pair with
the Elite Four theme and one with the
Gym Leader theme.)
override_detail_6040_1_06:
Hitting your opponent’s weaknesses is
the first step to becoming a proper
Trainer! Come at me with
supereffective attacks that take
advantage of my partner’s weakness!

(Use a supereffective attack while
completing Challenge Rika.)
override_detail_6040_1_07:
Ground-type Pokémon are so cute!
If you can find a sync pair that feels
the same way I do, we might get to
talkin’—and that’s your chance to
catch me off guard.

(Complete Challenge Rika with a team
including at least one sync pair with
the Ground theme.)
override_detail_6040_1_08:
Grass beats Water, which beats Fire,
which beats Grass... All Trainers have
to learn that fundamental concept.
Sticking to the basics is important,
so...bring along a Grass-, Water-,
and Fire-type sync pair to take down
good ol’ Rika!

(Complete Challenge Rika with a team
including one sync pair with the Grass
theme, one with the Fire theme, and
one with the Water theme.)
override_detail_6040_1_09:
In Paldea, the final test for those who
beat our Elite Four is our fearless
commander—the Top Champion! I’m
not sure if even I could win against
other Champions like that!

(Complete Challenge Rika with a team
including at least one sync pair with
the Champion theme.)
override_detail_6040_1_10:
Next up is the final test! I want a
great battle, one that’ll feel good
even to lose...just like the one I had
against that interesting kid who
passed the test back in Paldea!

(Complete Challenge Rika with a team
including at least one sync pair with
the Main Character theme.)
